business.headline: Exclusive: Will common man get insurance rate cut benefits in GST 2.0? FM answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear that the tax relief was introduced for citizens and not for insurance companies.

Popcorn puzzle solved: Nirmala Sitharaman explains GST classificationIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained why salted and chocolate-coated variants had earlier attracted different GST rates.

Why petrol, diesel is still not part of GST? Nirmala Sitharaman answersThe new GST 2.0 promises a simpler, two-rate structure and relief for many sectors. But fuel, petrol and diesel, remains outside its ambit. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has explained the reason behind this decision.

What's next after GST 2.0? Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 3.0 plansFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has confirmed that GST 2.0, with its new two-slab framework, will begin on 22 September 2025. But the bigger question is, what lies ahead in GST 3.0?

Benz vs Hawai chappal: Nirmala Sitharaman on why India isn't ready for uniform GSTIn an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that while "one nation, one tax" remains an aspirational idea, India's uneven levels of development make a uniform GST rate unfair.

Exclusive: How will government ensure GST cut benefits pass on to consumers? FM explainsFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed concerns about rate-cut benefits being passed on to people, explaining how the government plans to track the benefits in an exclusive with India Today.

GST rate cuts must be passed on to public, that's the focus: Nirmala SitharamanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said GST 2.0's success hinges on strict vigilance to ensure rate cuts are fully passed on to consumers.

GST rate cut, portfolio reset: Where should your money go now?The Goods and Services Tax (GST) is moving away from the four-slab system of 5%, 12%, 18% and 28% to a simpler structure of just two main rates, 5% and 18%.

Life and health insurance premiums exempt from GST: How much will you save?With full GST exemption, life and health insurance premiums could become lower, potentially saving policyholders several thousand rupees. The change is expected to cover all individual policies, including term plans, ULIPs, endowments, and senior citizen health plans.

Buying a home vs investing in stocks: Which builds more wealth, explains expertIndians often believe owning a house is the ultimate financial goal. But when it comes to wealth creation, stocks may have left property behind. An expert breaks down the real returns.

Explained: Why stock markets are down despite GST 2.0 reformsThe BSE Sensex slipped 254.91 points to 80,463.10, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 69.25 points to 24,665.05 at 12:08 pm. Both benchmarks had gained in early trade.

Government may announce schemes to help exporters hit by Trump tariffs: SourcesWith textiles, gems, and leather shipments now weighed down by a 50% duty, the government is drawing up a relief package aimed at keeping liquidity flowing and jobs intact.

entertainment.headline: Shah Rukh Khan aces salt and pepper look in leaked pics from King setsShah Rukh Khan is currently shooting for 'King' in Poland with Arshad Warsi. Pictures of the two stars from the sets have emerged online.

Baaghi 4 review: Tiger Shroff's film is 2.5 hours of coma, and you pay for the bedRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Baaghi 4 movie review: It is not just another Tiger Shroff action film, it's a close to three-hour hallucination where the story collapses so fast you don't get time to process, care, or even hope for a comeback.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 11: Baseer defeats Abhishek to become new captainBigg Boss 19: Baseer Ali won the captaincy task after a heated argument with Abhishek Bajaj. Earlier in the day, Mridul Tiwari was injured during a task. Kunickaa Sadanand and Tanya Mittal also clashed with each other.

Baaghi 4 X review: Tiger Shroff impresses some, others question his futureSeveral X users have shared their reviews on actor Tiger Shroff's film 'Baaghi 4'. The film released in theatres on September 5 and also features Sanjay Dutt, Sonam Bajwa and Harnaaz Sandhu.

Will the film industry benefit from government's new GST reform? Experts weigh inThe GST 2.0 reforms aim to make cinema tickets cheaper, but experts argue the impact will be minimal as Rs 100 tickets are nearly extinct. While single screens may see slight relief, multiplex audiences are unlikely to benefit.

Madharaasi review: Logic dies, but Sivakarthikeyan lives to tell gun culture taleRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Madharaasi movie review: Director AR Murugadoss's 'Madharaasi' starring Sivakarthikeyan, Rukmini Vasanth and Vidyut Jammwal, is a commercial actioner on gun culture. While the performances and action sequences win you over, the film's logical loopholes keep it a mediocre entertainer.

Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt cheer for Malayalam hit Lokah: Added to my watchlist'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' has made a remarkable impact as Malayalam cinema's first female superhero film, blending mythology with contemporary fantasy to captivate audiences across India. Praised by Bollywood stars and shattering box office records, it heralds a new era for women-led stories in regional cinema.

Not every film can be Saiyaara or Mahavatar Narsimha: KJo defends BollywoodKaran Johar addresses challenges in the Hindi film industry during 'Mirai' press meet. Speaking about 'Saiyaara' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha', he highlights that audience choice ultimately decides a film's success, rejecting any fixed formula or crisis.

The Conjuring Last Rites review: Horror compromised for a fairy tale closureRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025The Conjuring Last Rites movie review: The Conjuring Last Rites concludes the Warrens' story with a personal investigation. The film offers emotional closure but falls short on delivering fresh horror thrills.

Inspector Zende review: Manoj Bajpayee echoes Family Man magic in mediocre filmRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025'Inspector Zende' focuses on the cop who caught Charles Sobhraj twice, with Manoj Bajpayee delivering a compelling performance. The film blends period authenticity with police rivalry, but struggles with an uneven script.

Amitabh Bachchan donates Rs 11 lakh to Lalbaugcha RajaVeteran actor Amitabh Bachchan recently donated Rs 11 lakh to Lalbaugcha Raja. A viral picture of a cheque with the actor's signature has emerged online.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday dance atop bar counter at Tu Meri Main Tera wrap partyKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday celebrated the wrap of their romantic comedy 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri' with a lively dance to Amitabh Bachchan's 'Jumma Chumma De De'. The viral video is being shared widely across platforms.

Gege Akutami's Mojuro: Everything to know about the Jujutsu Kaisen spin-offDespite its successful run, 'Jujutsu Kaisen' concluded suddenly in 2024, leaving fans eager to see what creator Gege Akutami would work on next.

Jaydon deserved his father: Dalljiet Kaur on Shalin's absence from son's lifeActor Dalljiet Kaur has opened up about former husband Shalin Bhanot's absence from their son Jaydon's life. The actors got married in 2009 and separated in 2015.

Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Leonardo DiCaprio to Sonam Kapoor, celebs pay tributeItalian fashion designer Giorgio Armani died on September 4.He was 91. Many celebrities like Sonam Kapoor, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Reese Witherspoon among others, paid their tributes to the late designer.

Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

Hrithik emotional after watching Saba in Songs of Paradise, recalls her strugglesHrithik Roshan was moved by girlfriend Saba Azad's performance in 'Songs of Paradise.' In his heartfelt note, the actor praised her acting and recalled her struggles.

STR 49: Silambarasan steps into Vetri Maaran's Vada Chennai universeThe official glimpse of Vetri Maaran's 'STR 49', starring Silambarasan TR, has been unveiled, promising a gripping new chapter in the 'Vada Chennai' universe.

Baaghi 4 certified A after CBFC cuts violence and adult scenesTiger Shroff's Baaghi 4 receives an A certificate after multiple CBFC cuts for violence and adult content. The film's runtime was shortened voluntarily, highlighting increasing censorship challenges in Bollywood.

general news.headline: What's next after GST 2.0? Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 3.0 plansFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has confirmed that GST 2.0, with its new two-slab framework, will begin on 22 September 2025. But the bigger question is, what lies ahead in GST 3.0?

Will GST rate cuts reflect on MRP or companies loot gains?With GST rate rationalisation, the government is trying to provide relief to the common man and boost the economy. But will companies pass on the benefits to people, or will they pocket the gains? Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained on India Today TV why she believes the benefits would be passed on to the aam aadmi.

How dare you? Video of Ajit Pawar rebuking woman IPS officer goes viralIn the viral video, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar was heard telling IPS officer Anjana Krishna to halt the police crackdown on illegal murrum excavation in Maharashtra's Solapur.

'14 Pak terrorists, 400 kg RDX': Mumbai Police on high alert after threat messageThe threat message claimed that human bombs had been planted in 34 vehicles in Mumbai and that the city would be "shaken" after the blasts.

How pizza deliveries signal US military, political emergencyEarlier this week, when speculation over Donald Trump's alleged death was swirling, the Pentagon Pizza Index surged by 800%. Pizza orders near the Pentagon—the headquarters of the US Defence Department—are considered a barometer, hinting at officials at work for hours, during a crunch situation. This was also the case in June when the US bombed Iran. Even Soviet spies kept an eye on pizza orders during the Cold War.

B for Bidis and Bihar: Congress jibe backfires, apologises, BJP says exposedCongress Kerala unit's tweet mocking Bihar and bidis under GST reforms sparked a political uproar. Bihar NDA leaders condemned the remark, calling it insult to the state.

Lookout notice against actor Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra in Rs 60-crore fraud caseShilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra are accused of diverting nearly Rs 60 crore from Best Deal TV for personal use, prompting an Lookout Circular (LOC) by Mumbai Police.

Trump flexes US tech muscle in dinner meet with CEOs. But why now?Days after China flexed its military muscle in its Victory Day parade, President Donald Trump flaunted what the US prides itself on - AI and technology. On Thursday, the who's who of Silicon Valley attended a lavish dinner meet at the White House.

Do your homework: Nirmala Sitharaman hits back at Opposition over GST criticismNirmala Sitharaman slammed the Opposition over its GST criticism, saying they were misinformed and should "do their homework" before making claims. She defended the timing of reforms, arguing previous governments failed to implement GST for decades due to lack of trust from states.
The multiple messages from Xi's military parade flexFrom nuclear deterrence to multi-domain warfare, China announced its arrival as a power of consequence.

Hello blonde hair: Kate Middleton debuts bold new lookUK royal Kate Middleton created a major buzz as she debuted her new blonde look, a striking departure from her signature chestnut hair.

Odisha's 400-year-old Sarsatia sweet eyes GI tag; a taste of history and heritageEfforts are underway to secure a GI tag for Sambalpur's 400-year-old Sarsatia sweet. Historical records trace the delicacy back to the 16th century, when it was a household favourite in western Odisha. It is offered to Maa Samaleswari during festivals like Dussehra, highlighting its cultural ties.

Asia Cup 2025: How India can reach the final in Rajgir? Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

The film blends period authenticity with police rivalry, but struggles with an uneven script.

Tesla delivers first Model Y in India, goes to the garage of a ministerTesla delivered its first Model Y in India from Mumbai's recently opened experience centre, with the electric SUV going to the garage of a minister.

Beyond the parade: Decoding China's message to rivals and allies alikeChinese observers say that the event is meant to be an ultimatum to the Japanese side to retreat, particularly on the Taiwan issue. China hopes that the exhibition of strength will make Japan more restrained and prevent it from taking the "Taiwan's problems are Japan's problems" stance.

Remembering Giorgio Armani, architect of modern style and red-carpet glamourGiorgio Armani reshaped menswear and womenswear alike, dressing stars from Richard Gere to Aishwarya Rai Bachchan with his timeless elegance.

Nirmala Sitharaman denies Trump link to GST reforms: Been in works for 1.5 yearsSpeaking exclusively to India Today, Sitharaman denied any Trump tariff link to the recent GST overhaul and said that the government had been working on the reforms for 1.5 years.

Called it Gabbar Singh Tax, now taking credit: Nirmala Sitharaman taunts CongressNirmala Sitharaman, in an exclusive interview, emphasised that during the tenure of Indira Gandhi, India had some of the highest income tax rates in the world.

How Gavin Newsom, whose ex-wife dated Trump Jr, became Trump's biggest rivalCalifornia Governor and Democrat Gavin Newsom has embraced Trump-style online trolling, targeting Trump and his aides, boosting his poll numbers. His shift from civil messaging to memes and viral content has shaken Republicans and energised Democrats. Adding drama, his ex-wife Kimberly Guilfoyle later became Trump Jr's fiancee, before the couple called off their engagement.

sports.headline: Mitchell Starc admits he forgot to inform teammates of T20I retirementMitchell Starc has retired from T20 internationals, surprising teammates and fans alike. The veteran pacer, Australia's second-highest T20I wicket-taker, chose to focus on Tests and ODIs, with the 2027 World Cup and packed red-ball calendar in sight.

Osaka jokes US Open exit stings less than missing her 'Osaka labubu' revealNaomi Osaka lost a marathon US Open semifinal but stayed positive about her comeback. She missed unveiling a special Labubu plush in the final, which disappointed her fans and herself.

John Cena's retirement tour: Chicago SmackDown could be his final appearanceJohn Cena is set for a potentially final SmackDown appearance in Chicago, with the event also expected to set the stage for a high-profile showdown with Brock Lesnar, further intensifying the anticipation.

ENG vs SA: Harry Brook dismisses fatigue as excuse after ODI series defeatHarry Brook said that despite the constant workload on key players, he wants his best side to play in every white-ball game. He is focused on the next two ICC tournaments and admitted to making tactical blunders in the second ODI against South Africa.

After CAFA Cup let down, AIFF confirms Sandesh Jhinghan has undergone suregerySandesh Jhingan's cheekbone fracture and subsequent surgery have left India's Asian Cup qualifying hopes hanging in the balance. With the veteran sidelined, centre-back partner Anwar Ali will now be tasked with anchoring the defence.

Top 10 amateurs set to shine at legendary Cypress Point in CaliforniaThe Walker Cup returns to the legendary Cypress Point Club after more than four decades. This exclusive amateur golf event showcases top talent amid stunning coastal views, drawing keen attention despite competing sports broadcasts.

Sabalenka responds to Kyrgios with bold Battle of the Sexes vow: Going to kick his a**Aryna Sabalenka has fired back at Nick Kyrgios with a bold promise ahead of their much-talked-about "Battle of the Sexes" clash. The World No. 1 said she will try to outclass Kyrgios, turning the Australian's sledge on its head and adding spice to a showdown that has already sparked global debate.

From despair to dominance: India's redemption against MalaysiaIndia overcame an early setback to beat Malaysia 4-1 in a crucial Asia Cup clash. After the disappointment of a draw against Korea, Harmanpreet Singh's men showed resilience and character to secure an important win and move a step closer to the final.

Could this young star be Argentina's next Messi? Former boss weighs inJose Pekerman believes 18-year-old Franco Mastantuono could be the closest successor to Lionel Messi, but Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni insists that no one can match Messi's unparalleled legacy.

Osaka's resurgent run ends as Anisimova books final date vs SabalenkaUS Open 2025: Amanda Anisimova staged a remarkable comeback to beat Naomi Osaka in the US Open semi-final. She will face defending champion Aryna Sabalenka in the final.

Asia Cup Hockey daily digest: India sing redemption song in Rajgir, inch closer to finalThe Indian team produced a stunning performance to come back from a goal down to beat Malaysia 4-1 and take a big step towards qualifying for the Asia Cup 2025 final. But familiar foes in the form of China awaits Harmanpreet Singh and his side with all four teams retaining a chance to make it to the summit clash. Alan John joins hands with veteran sports journalist Sundeep Misra for the analysis of the second round of the Super 4s and the final set of matches of the phase on September 6.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
